````java path=Enset/ProjectManagement/src/main/java/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/MainController.java mode=EDIT
package com.zakaria.projectmanagement;

import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers.HomeController;
import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers.RFCController;
import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers.RFIController;
import javafx.application.Application;
import javafx.fxml.FXMLLoader;
import javafx.geometry.Rectangle2D;
import javafx.scene.Parent;
import javafx.scene.Scene;
import javafx.stage.Screen;
import javafx.stage.Stage;

import java.io.IOException;

public class MainController extends Application {

 private Stage primaryStage;
 private Scene homeScene;
 private Scene rfcScene;
 private Scene rfiScene;
 
 // Store original window size
 private double originalWidth;
 private double originalHeight;
 private boolean isMaximized = false;

 @Override
 public void start(Stage primaryStage) throws Exception {
 this.primaryStage = primaryStage;
 primaryStage.setTitle("RFC/RFI Generator");

 // Get screen dimensions
 Rectangle2D screenBounds = Screen.getPrimary().getVisualBounds();
 originalWidth = screenBounds.getWidth() * 0.8;
 originalHeight = screenBounds.getHeight() * 0.8;
 
 primaryStage.setWidth(originalWidth);
 primaryStage.setHeight(originalHeight);

 // Set minimum size
 primaryStage.setMinWidth(1024);
 primaryStage.setMinHeight(768);

 // Load all scenes
 loadHomeScene();
 loadRFCScene();
 loadRFIScene();

 primaryStage.setScene(homeScene);
 primaryStage.show();
 }

 private void loadHomeScene() throws IOException {
 FXMLLoader loader = new FXMLLoader(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/fxml/homeScene.fxml"));
 Parent root = loader.load();

 HomeController homeController = loader.getController();
 homeController.setMainController(this);

 homeScene = new Scene(root);
 homeScene.getStylesheets().add(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/css/style.css").toExternalForm());
 }

 private void loadRFCScene() throws IOException {
 FXMLLoader loader = new FXMLLoader(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/fxml/rfcScene.fxml"));
 Parent root = loader.load();

 RFCController rfcController = loader.getController();
 rfcController.setMainController(this);

 rfcScene = new Scene(root);
 rfcScene.getStylesheets().add(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/css/style.css").toExternalForm());
 }

 private void loadRFIScene() throws IOException {
 FXMLLoader loader = new FXMLLoader(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/fxml/rfiScene.fxml"));
 Parent root = loader.load();

 RFIController rfiController = loader.getController();
 rfiController.setMainController(this);

 rfiScene = new Scene(root);
 rfiScene.getStylesheets().add(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/css/style.css").toExternalForm());
 }

 public void showHomeScene() {
 // Restore original size if coming from maximized state
 if (isMaximized) {
 primaryStage.setMaximized(false);
 primaryStage.setWidth(originalWidth);
 primaryStage.setHeight(originalHeight);
 isMaximized = false;
 }
 primaryStage.setScene(homeScene);
 }

 public void showRFCScene() {
 primaryStage.setScene(rfcScene);
 // Maximize the window
 primaryStage.setMaximized(true);
 isMaximized = true;
 }

 public void showRFIScene() {
 primaryStage.setScene(rfiScene);
 // Maximize the window
 primaryStage.setMaximized(true);
 isMaximized = true;
 }

 public static void main(String[] args) {
 launch(args);
 }
}
````

This implementation:

1. Stores the original window dimensions (80% of screen size) in `originalWidth` and `originalHeight`
2. Adds a boolean flag `isMaximized` to track the window state
3. Modifies `showHomeScene()` to restore the original window size if coming from a maximized state
4. Updates `showRFCScene()` and `showRFIScene()` to maximize the window using `primaryStage.setMaximized(true)`

Now when you click on RFC or RFI buttons, the window will maximize to fill the screen, and when you return to the home scene, it will restore to its original size (80% of the screen).

the homescene also maximized ","rich_text_json_repr":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"make the homescene also maximized "}]}]},"mentioned_items":[],"structured_output_nodes":[{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"Let's modify the `MainController.java` to make all scenes maximized, including the home scene:

<augment_code_snippet path="Enset/ProjectManagement/src/main/java/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/MainController.java" mode="EDIT">
```java
package com.zakaria.projectmanagement;

import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers.HomeController;
import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers.RFCController;
import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers.RFIController;
import javafx.application.Application;
import javafx.fxml.FXMLLoader;
import javafx.geometry.Rectangle2D;
import javafx.scene.Parent;
import javafx.scene.Scene;
import javafx.stage.Screen;
import javafx.stage.Stage;

import java.io.IOException;

public class MainController extends Application {

 private Stage primaryStage;
 private Scene homeScene;
 private Scene rfcScene;
 private Scene rfiScene;

 @Override
 public void start(Stage primaryStage) throws Exception {
 this.primaryStage = primaryStage;
 primaryStage.setTitle("RFC/RFI Generator");

 // Set minimum size
 primaryStage.setMinWidth(1024);
 primaryStage.setMinHeight(768);

 // Load all scenes
 loadHomeScene();
 loadRFCScene();
 loadRFIScene();

 // Set the initial scene and maximize
 primaryStage.setScene(homeScene);
 primaryStage.setMaximized(true);
 primaryStage.show();
 }

 private void loadHomeScene() throws IOException {
 FXMLLoader loader = new FXMLLoader(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/fxml/homeScene.fxml"));
 Parent root = loader.load();

 HomeController homeController = loader.getController();
 homeController.setMainController(this);

 homeScene = new Scene(root);
 homeScene.getStylesheets().add(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/css/style.css").toExternalForm());
 }

 private void loadRFCScene() throws IOException {
 FXMLLoader loader = new FXMLLoader(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/fxml/rfcScene.fxml"));
 Parent root = loader.load();

 RFCController rfcController = loader.getController();
 rfcController.setMainController(this);

 rfcScene = new Scene(root);
 rfcScene.getStylesheets().add(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/css/style.css").toExternalForm());
 }

 private void loadRFIScene() throws IOException {
 FXMLLoader loader = new FXMLLoader(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/fxml/rfiScene.fxml"));
 Parent root = loader.load();

 RFIController rfiController = loader.getController();
 rfiController.setMainController(this);

 rfiScene = new Scene(root);
 rfiScene.getStylesheets().add(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/css/style.css").toExternalForm());
 }

 public void showHomeScene() {
 primaryStage.setScene(homeScene);
 }

 public void showRFCScene() {
 primaryStage.setScene(rfcScene);
 }

 public void showRFIScene() {
 primaryStage.setScene(rfiScene);
 }

 public static void main(String[] args) {
 launch(args);
 }
}
```
</augment_code_snippet>

I've simplified the code by:

1. Removing the `originalWidth`, `originalHeight`, and `isMaximized` variables since we no longer need to track window state
2. Setting the window to maximized once during startup with `primaryStage.setMaximized(true)`
3. Simplifying the scene switching methods since they no longer need to handle window size changes

Now all scenes (home, RFC, and RFI) will be displayed maximized, and the window will remain maximized when switching between them.

````java path=Enset/ProjectManagement/src/main/java/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/MainController.java mode=EDIT
package com.zakaria.projectmanagement;

import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers.HomeController;
import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers.RFCController;
import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers.RFIController;
import javafx.application.Application;
import javafx.fxml.FXMLLoader;
import javafx.geometry.Rectangle2D;
import javafx.scene.Parent;
import javafx.scene.Scene;
import javafx.stage.Screen;
import javafx.stage.Stage;

import java.io.IOException;

public class MainController extends Application {

 private Stage primaryStage;
 private Scene homeScene;
 private Scene rfcScene;
 private Scene rfiScene;

 @Override
 public void start(Stage primaryStage) throws Exception {
 this.primaryStage = primaryStage;
 primaryStage.setTitle("RFC/RFI Generator");

 // Set minimum size
 primaryStage.setMinWidth(1024);
 primaryStage.setMinHeight(768);

 // Load all scenes
 loadHomeScene();
 loadRFCScene();
 loadRFIScene();

 // Set the initial scene and maximize
 primaryStage.setScene(homeScene);
 primaryStage.setMaximized(true);
 primaryStage.show();
 }

 private void loadHomeScene() throws IOException {
 FXMLLoader loader = new FXMLLoader(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/fxml/homeScene.fxml"));
 Parent root = loader.load();

 HomeController homeController = loader.getController();
 homeController.setMainController(this);

 homeScene = new Scene(root);
 homeScene.getStylesheets().add(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/css/style.css").toExternalForm());
 }

 private void loadRFCScene() throws IOException {
 FXMLLoader loader = new FXMLLoader(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/fxml/rfcScene.fxml"));
 Parent root = loader.load();

 RFCController rfcController = loader.getController();
 rfcController.setMainController(this);

 rfcScene = new Scene(root);
 rfcScene.getStylesheets().add(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/css/style.css").toExternalForm());
 }

 private void loadRFIScene() throws IOException {
 FXMLLoader loader = new FXMLLoader(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/fxml/rfiScene.fxml"));
 Parent root = loader.load();

 RFIController rfiController = loader.getController();
 rfiController.setMainController(this);

 rfiScene = new Scene(root);
 rfiScene.getStylesheets().add(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/css/style.css").toExternalForm());
 }

 public void showHomeScene() {
 primaryStage.setScene(homeScene);
 }

 public void showRFCScene() {
 primaryStage.setScene(rfcScene);
 }

 public void showRFIScene() {
 primaryStage.setScene(rfiScene);
 }

 public static void main(String[] args) {
 launch(args);
 }
}
````

I've simplified the code by:

1. Removing the `originalWidth`, `originalHeight`, and `isMaximized` variables since we no longer need to track window state
2. Setting the window to maximized once during startup with `primaryStage.setMaximized(true)`
3. Simplifying the scene switching methods since they no longer need to handle window size changes

Now all scenes (home, RFC, and RFI) will be displayed maximized, and the window will remain maximized when switching between them.

and when I go back from RFC or RFI the homescene is no longer maximized ","rich_text_json_repr":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"there is a problem now when I click in the RFC or RFI it maximized but it goes to left side "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"and when I go back from RFC or RFI the homescene is no longer maximized "}]}]},"mentioned_items":[],"structured_output_nodes":[{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"Let's fix these issues by ensuring all scenes remain properly maximized and centered. Here's an updated version of the `MainController.java`:

<augment_code_snippet path="Enset/ProjectManagement/src/main/java/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/MainController.java" mode="EDIT">
```java
package com.zakaria.projectmanagement;

import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers.HomeController;
import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers.RFCController;
import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers.RFIController;
import javafx.application.Application;
import javafx.fxml.FXMLLoader;
import javafx.geometry.Rectangle2D;
import javafx.scene.Parent;
import javafx.scene.Scene;
import javafx.stage.Screen;
import javafx.stage.Stage;

import java.io.IOException;

public class MainController extends Application {

 private Stage primaryStage;
 private Scene homeScene;
 private Scene rfcScene;
 private Scene rfiScene;

 @Override
 public void start(Stage primaryStage) throws Exception {
 this.primaryStage = primaryStage;
 primaryStage.setTitle("RFC/RFI Generator");

 // Set minimum size
 primaryStage.setMinWidth(1024);
 primaryStage.setMinHeight(768);

 // Load all scenes
 loadHomeScene();
 loadRFCScene();
 loadRFIScene();

 // Set the initial scene
 primaryStage.setScene(homeScene);
 
 // Show the stage first, then maximize it
 primaryStage.show();
 primaryStage.setMaximized(true);
 }

 private void loadHomeScene() throws IOException {
 FXMLLoader loader = new FXMLLoader(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/fxml/homeScene.fxml"));
 Parent root = loader.load();

 HomeController homeController = loader.getController();
 homeController.setMainController(this);

 homeScene = new Scene(root);
 homeScene.getStylesheets().add(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/css/style.css").toExternalForm());
 }

 private void loadRFCScene() throws IOException {
 FXMLLoader loader = new FXMLLoader(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/fxml/rfcScene.fxml"));
 Parent root = loader.load();

 RFCController rfcController = loader.getController();
 rfcController.setMainController(this);

 rfcScene = new Scene(root);
 rfcScene.getStylesheets().add(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/css/style.css").toExternalForm());
 }

 private void loadRFIScene() throws IOException {
 FXMLLoader loader = new FXMLLoader(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/fxml/rfiScene.fxml"));
 Parent root = loader.load();

 RFIController rfiController = loader.getController();
 rfiController.setMainController(this);

 rfiScene = new Scene(root);
 rfiScene.getStylesheets().add(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/css/style.css").toExternalForm());
 }

 public void showHomeScene() {
 primaryStage.setScene(homeScene);
 // Ensure it stays maximized
 primaryStage.setMaximized(true);
 }

 public void showRFCScene() {
 primaryStage.setScene(rfcScene);
 // Ensure it stays maximized
 primaryStage.setMaximized(true);
 }

 public void showRFIScene() {
 primaryStage.setScene(rfiScene);
 // Ensure it stays maximized
 primaryStage.setMaximized(true);
 }

 public static void main(String[] args) {
 launch(args);
 }
}
```
</augment_code_snippet>

The key changes are:

1. Changed the order in the `start` method to first show the stage and then maximize it, which can help with proper positioning
2. Added `primaryStage.setMaximized(true)` to each scene switching method to ensure the window stays maximized when switching between scenes

This should fix both issues:
- The RFC and RFI scenes should be properly centered when maximized
- The home scene should remain maximized when returning from RFC or RFI scenes

If you're still experiencing issues with the window positioning, we might need to add additional layout constraints to the FXML files to ensure content is properly centered within the maximized window.

and when I go back from RFC or RFI the homescene is no longer maximized "}},{"id":1,"type":4,"ide_state_node":{"workspaceFolders":[{"repositoryRoot":"C:/Users/Dell/Desktop/Studies","folderRoot":"C:/Users/Dell/Desktop/Studies"}],"workspaceFoldersUnchanged":false}}],"timestamp":"2025-06-04T15:16:44.816Z","response_text":"Let's fix these issues by ensuring all scenes remain properly maximized and centered. Here's an updated version of the `MainController.java`:

````java path=Enset/ProjectManagement/src/main/java/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/MainController.java mode=EDIT
package com.zakaria.projectmanagement;

import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers.HomeController;
import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers.RFCController;
import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers.RFIController;
import javafx.application.Application;
import javafx.fxml.FXMLLoader;
import javafx.geometry.Rectangle2D;
import javafx.scene.Parent;
import javafx.scene.Scene;
import javafx.stage.Screen;
import javafx.stage.Stage;

import java.io.IOException;

public class MainController extends Application {

 private Stage primaryStage;
 private Scene homeScene;
 private Scene rfcScene;
 private Scene rfiScene;

 @Override
 public void start(Stage primaryStage) throws Exception {
 this.primaryStage = primaryStage;
 primaryStage.setTitle("RFC/RFI Generator");

 // Set minimum size
 primaryStage.setMinWidth(1024);
 primaryStage.setMinHeight(768);

 // Load all scenes
 loadHomeScene();
 loadRFCScene();
 loadRFIScene();

 // Set the initial scene
 primaryStage.setScene(homeScene);
 
 // Show the stage first, then maximize it
 primaryStage.show();
 primaryStage.setMaximized(true);
 }

 private void loadHomeScene() throws IOException {
 FXMLLoader loader = new FXMLLoader(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/fxml/homeScene.fxml"));
 Parent root = loader.load();

 HomeController homeController = loader.getController();
 homeController.setMainController(this);

 homeScene = new Scene(root);
 homeScene.getStylesheets().add(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/css/style.css").toExternalForm());
 }

 private void loadRFCScene() throws IOException {
 FXMLLoader loader = new FXMLLoader(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/fxml/rfcScene.fxml"));
 Parent root = loader.load();

 RFCController rfcController = loader.getController();
 rfcController.setMainController(this);

 rfcScene = new Scene(root);
 rfcScene.getStylesheets().add(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/css/style.css").toExternalForm());
 }

 private void loadRFIScene() throws IOException {
 FXMLLoader loader = new FXMLLoader(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/fxml/rfiScene.fxml"));
 Parent root = loader.load();

 RFIController rfiController = loader.getController();
 rfiController.setMainController(this);

 rfiScene = new Scene(root);
 rfiScene.getStylesheets().add(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/css/style.css").toExternalForm());
 }

 public void showHomeScene() {
 primaryStage.setScene(homeScene);
 // Ensure it stays maximized
 primaryStage.setMaximized(true);
 }

 public void showRFCScene() {
 primaryStage.setScene(rfcScene);
 // Ensure it stays maximized
 primaryStage.setMaximized(true);
 }

 public void showRFIScene() {
 primaryStage.setScene(rfiScene);
 // Ensure it stays maximized
 primaryStage.setMaximized(true);
 }

 public static void main(String[] args) {
 launch(args);
 }
}
````

The key changes are:

1. Changed the order in the `start` method to first show the stage and then maximize it, which can help with proper positioning
2. Added `primaryStage.setMaximized(true)` to each scene switching method to ensure the window stays maximized when switching between scenes

This should fix both issues:
- The RFC and RFI scenes should be properly centered when maximized
- The home scene should remain maximized when returning from RFC or RFI scenes

If you're still experiencing issues with the window positioning, we might need to add additional layout constraints to the FXML files to ensure content is properly centered within the maximized window.

package com.zakaria.projectmanagement;

import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers.HomeController;
import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers.RFCController;
import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers.RFIController;
import javafx.application.Application;
import javafx.fxml.FXMLLoader;
import javafx.geometry.Rectangle2D;
import javafx.scene.Parent;
import javafx.scene.Scene;
import javafx.stage.Screen;
import javafx.stage.Stage;

import java.io.IOException;

public class MainController extends Application {

 private Stage primaryStage;
 private Scene homeScene;
 private Scene rfcScene;
 private Scene rfiScene;
 
 // Store dimensions for home screen
 private double homeWidth;
 private double homeHeight;
 private boolean isMaximized = false;

 @Override
 public void start(Stage primaryStage) throws Exception {
 this.primaryStage = primaryStage;
 primaryStage.setTitle("RFC/RFI Generator");

 // Get screen dimensions
 Rectangle2D screenBounds = Screen.getPrimary().getVisualBounds();
 
 // Set home screen size to 80% of screen size
 homeWidth = screenBounds.getWidth() * 0.8;
 homeHeight = screenBounds.getHeight() * 0.8;

 // Set minimum size
 primaryStage.setMinWidth(1024);
 primaryStage.setMinHeight(768);

 // Load all scenes
 loadHomeScene();
 loadRFCScene();
 loadRFIScene();

 // Set the initial scene
 showHomeScene();
 
 // Show the stage
 primaryStage.show();
 }

 private void loadHomeScene() throws IOException {
 FXMLLoader loader = new FXMLLoader(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/fxml/homeScene.fxml"));
 Parent root = loader.load();

 HomeController homeController = loader.getController();
 homeController.setMainController(this);

 homeScene = new Scene(root);
 homeScene.getStylesheets().add(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/css/style.css").toExternalForm());
 }

 private void loadRFCScene() throws IOException {
 FXMLLoader loader = new FXMLLoader(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/fxml/rfcScene.fxml"));
 Parent root = loader.load();

 RFCController rfcController = loader.getController();
 rfcController.setMainController(this);

 rfcScene = new Scene(root);
 rfcScene.getStylesheets().add(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/css/style.css").toExternalForm());
 }

 private void loadRFIScene() throws IOException {
 FXMLLoader loader = new FXMLLoader(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/fxml/rfiScene.fxml"));
 Parent root = loader.load();

 RFIController rfiController = loader.getController();
 rfiController.setMainController(this);

 rfiScene = new Scene(root);
 rfiScene.getStylesheets().add(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/css/style.css").toExternalForm());
 }

 public void showHomeScene() {
 // If currently maximized, restore to normal size
 if (isMaximized) {
 primaryStage.setMaximized(false);
 isMaximized = false;
 }
 
 // Set home screen size
 primaryStage.setWidth(homeWidth);
 primaryStage.setHeight(homeHeight);
 
 // Center the window on screen
 Rectangle2D screenBounds = Screen.getPrimary().getVisualBounds();
 primaryStage.setX((screenBounds.getWidth() - homeWidth) / 2);
 primaryStage.setY((screenBounds.getHeight() - homeHeight) / 2);
 
 // Set the scene
 primaryStage.setScene(homeScene);
 }

 public void showRFCScene() {
 primaryStage.setScene(rfcScene);
 // Maximize the window
 primaryStage.setMaximized(true);
 isMaximized = true;
 }

 public void showRFIScene() {
 primaryStage.setScene(rfiScene);
 // Maximize the window
 primaryStage.setMaximized(true);
 isMaximized = true;
 }

 public static void main(String[] args) {
 launch(args);
 }
}
```
</augment_code_snippet>

Key changes:

1. Added variables to store the home screen dimensions (`homeWidth` and `homeHeight`) and a flag to track if the window is maximized
2. Modified `showHomeScene()` to:
 - Restore the window from maximized state if needed
 - Set the window size to 80% of the screen
 - Center the window on the screen using `setX()` and `setY()`
3. Modified `showRFCScene()` and `showRFIScene()` to maximize the window and update the flag
4. Changed the `start()` method to call `showHomeScene()` directly to set up the initial window state

This implementation ensures:
- The home screen is always displayed at 80% of the screen size and centered
- The RFC and RFI screens are always maximized
- The window properly transitions between these states when switching scenes

````java path=Enset/ProjectManagement/src/main/java/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/MainController.java mode=EDIT
package com.zakaria.projectmanagement;

import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers.HomeController;
import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers.RFCController;
import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers.RFIController;
import javafx.application.Application;
import javafx.fxml.FXMLLoader;
import javafx.geometry.Rectangle2D;
import javafx.scene.Parent;
import javafx.scene.Scene;
import javafx.stage.Screen;
import javafx.stage.Stage;

import java.io.IOException;

public class MainController extends Application {

 private Stage primaryStage;
 private Scene homeScene;
 private Scene rfcScene;
 private Scene rfiScene;
 
 // Store dimensions for home screen
 private double homeWidth;
 private double homeHeight;
 private boolean isMaximized = false;

 @Override
 public void start(Stage primaryStage) throws Exception {
 this.primaryStage = primaryStage;
 primaryStage.setTitle("RFC/RFI Generator");

 // Get screen dimensions
 Rectangle2D screenBounds = Screen.getPrimary().getVisualBounds();
 
 // Set home screen size to 80% of screen size
 homeWidth = screenBounds.getWidth() * 0.8;
 homeHeight = screenBounds.getHeight() * 0.8;

 // Set minimum size
 primaryStage.setMinWidth(1024);
 primaryStage.setMinHeight(768);

 // Load all scenes
 loadHomeScene();
 loadRFCScene();
 loadRFIScene();

 // Set the initial scene
 showHomeScene();
 
 // Show the stage
 primaryStage.show();
 }

 private void loadHomeScene() throws IOException {
 FXMLLoader loader = new FXMLLoader(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/fxml/homeScene.fxml"));
 Parent root = loader.load();

 HomeController homeController = loader.getController();
 homeController.setMainController(this);

 homeScene = new Scene(root);
 homeScene.getStylesheets().add(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/css/style.css").toExternalForm());
 }

 private void loadRFCScene() throws IOException {
 FXMLLoader loader = new FXMLLoader(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/fxml/rfcScene.fxml"));
 Parent root = loader.load();

 RFCController rfcController = loader.getController();
 rfcController.setMainController(this);

 rfcScene = new Scene(root);
 rfcScene.getStylesheets().add(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/css/style.css").toExternalForm());
 }

 private void loadRFIScene() throws IOException {
 FXMLLoader loader = new FXMLLoader(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/fxml/rfiScene.fxml"));
 Parent root = loader.load();

 RFIController rfiController = loader.getController();
 rfiController.setMainController(this);

 rfiScene = new Scene(root);
 rfiScene.getStylesheets().add(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/css/style.css").toExternalForm());
 }

 public void showHomeScene() {
 // If currently maximized, restore to normal size
 if (isMaximized) {
 primaryStage.setMaximized(false);
 isMaximized = false;
 }
 
 // Set home screen size
 primaryStage.setWidth(homeWidth);
 primaryStage.setHeight(homeHeight);
 
 // Center the window on screen
 Rectangle2D screenBounds = Screen.getPrimary().getVisualBounds();
 primaryStage.setX((screenBounds.getWidth() - homeWidth) / 2);
 primaryStage.setY((screenBounds.getHeight() - homeHeight) / 2);
 
 // Set the scene
 primaryStage.setScene(homeScene);
 }

 public void showRFCScene() {
 primaryStage.setScene(rfcScene);
 // Maximize the window
 primaryStage.setMaximized(true);
 isMaximized = true;
 }

 public void showRFIScene() {
 primaryStage.setScene(rfiScene);
 // Maximize the window
 primaryStage.setMaximized(true);
 isMaximized = true;
 }

 public static void main(String[] args) {
 launch(args);
 }
}
````

Key changes:

1. Added variables to store the home screen dimensions (`homeWidth` and `homeHeight`) and a flag to track if the window is maximized
2. Modified `showHomeScene()` to:
 - Restore the window from maximized state if needed
 - Set the window size to 80% of the screen
 - Center the window on the screen using `setX()` and `setY()`
3. Modified `showRFCScene()` and `showRFIScene()` to maximize the window and update the flag
4. Changed the `start()` method to call `showHomeScene()` directly to set up the initial window state

This implementation ensures:
- The home screen is always displayed at 80% of the screen size and centered
- The RFC and RFI screens are always maximized
- The window properly transitions between these states when switching scenes

```java
package com.zakaria.projectmanagement;

import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers.HomeController;
import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers.RFCController;
import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers.RFIController;
import javafx.application.Application;
import javafx.fxml.FXMLLoader;
import javafx.geometry.Rectangle2D;
import javafx.scene.Parent;
import javafx.scene.Scene;
import javafx.stage.Screen;
import javafx.stage.Stage;
import javafx.stage.StageStyle;

import java.io.IOException;

public class MainController extends Application {

 private Stage primaryStage;
 private Scene homeScene;
 private Scene rfcScene;
 private Scene rfiScene;
 
 // Store dimensions for home screen
 private double homeWidth;
 private double homeHeight;
 private boolean isMaximized = false;

 @Override
 public void start(Stage primaryStage) throws Exception {
 this.primaryStage = primaryStage;
 primaryStage.setTitle("RFC/RFI Generator");

 // Get screen dimensions
 Rectangle2D screenBounds = Screen.getPrimary().getVisualBounds();
 
 // Set home screen size to 80% of screen size
 homeWidth = screenBounds.getWidth() * 0.8;
 homeHeight = screenBounds.getHeight() * 0.8;

 // Set minimum size
 primaryStage.setMinWidth(1024);
 primaryStage.setMinHeight(768);

 // Load all scenes
 loadHomeScene();
 loadRFCScene();
 loadRFIScene();

 // Set the initial scene
 showHomeScene();
 
 // Show the stage
 primaryStage.show();
 }

 private void loadHomeScene() throws IOException {
 FXMLLoader loader = new FXMLLoader(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/fxml/homeScene.fxml"));
 Parent root = loader.load();

 HomeController homeController = loader.getController();
 homeController.setMainController(this);

 homeScene = new Scene(root);
 homeScene.getStylesheets().add(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/css/style.css").toExternalForm());
 }

 private void loadRFCScene() throws IOException {
 FXMLLoader loader = new FXMLLoader(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/fxml/rfcScene.fxml"));
 Parent root = loader.load();

 RFCController rfcController = loader.getController();
 rfcController.setMainController(this);

 rfcScene = new Scene(root);
 rfcScene.getStylesheets().add(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/css/style.css").toExternalForm());
 }

 private void loadRFIScene() throws IOException {
 FXMLLoader loader = new FXMLLoader(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/fxml/rfiScene.fxml"));
 Parent root = loader.load();

 RFIController rfiController = loader.getController();
 rfiController.setMainController(this);

 rfiScene = new Scene(root);
 rfiScene.getStylesheets().add(getClass().getResource("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/css/style.css").toExternalForm());
 }

 public void showHomeScene() {
 // If currently maximized, restore to normal size
 if (isMaximized) {
 primaryStage.setMaximized(false);
 isMaximized = false;
 }
 
 // Set home screen size
 primaryStage.setWidth(homeWidth);
 primaryStage.setHeight(homeHeight);
 
 // Center the window on screen
 Rectangle2D screenBounds = Screen.getPrimary().getVisualBounds();
 primaryStage.setX((screenBounds.getWidth() - homeWidth) / 2);
 primaryStage.setY((screenBounds.getHeight() - homeHeight) / 2);
 
 // Disable maximizing for home scene
 primaryStage.setResizable(true);
 primaryStage.setMaximized(false);
 primaryStage.setMaxHeight(homeHeight);
 primaryStage.setMaxWidth(homeWidth);
 
 // Set the scene
 primaryStage.setScene(homeScene);
 }

 public void showRFCScene() {
 // Enable resizing and remove max size constraints
 primaryStage.setResizable(true);
 primaryStage.setMaxHeight(Double.MAX_VALUE);
 primaryStage.setMaxWidth(Double.MAX_VALUE);
 
 // Set the scene
 primaryStage.setScene(rfcScene);
 
 // Maximize the window
 primaryStage.setMaximized(true);
 isMaximized = true;
 }

 public void showRFIScene() {
 // Enable resizing and remove max size constraints
 primaryStage.setResizable(true);
 primaryStage.setMaxHeight(Double.MAX_VALUE);
 primaryStage.setMaxWidth(Double.MAX_VALUE);
 
 // Set the scene
 primaryStage.setScene(rfiScene);
 
 // Maximize the window
 primaryStage.setMaximized(true);
 isMaximized = true;
 }

 public static void main(String[] args) {
 launch(args);
 }
}
```
</augment_code_snippet>

Key changes:

1. In `showHomeScene()`, I've added:
 - `primaryStage.setMaximized(false)` to ensure the window is not maximized
 - `primaryStage.setMaxHeight(homeHeight)` and `primaryStage.setMaxWidth(homeWidth)` to limit the maximum size of the window to the home dimensions, effectively preventing maximization

2. In `showRFCScene()` and `showRFIScene()`, I've added:
 - `primaryStage.setMaxHeight(Double.MAX_VALUE)` and `primaryStage.setMaxWidth(Double.MAX_VALUE)` to remove the size constraints before maximizing

This approach prevents the user from maximizing the home screen by setting a maximum size constraint equal to the desired home screen size, while still allowing the RFC and RFI screens to be maximized.

I'll add methods to both controllers to handle this.

First, let's modify the `RFCController.java`:

<augment_code_snippet path="Enset/ProjectManagement/src/main/java/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/controllers/RFCController.java" mode="EDIT">

package com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers;

import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.MainController;
import javafx.collections.FXCollections;
import javafx.fxml.FXML;
import javafx.scene.control.*;
import javafx.beans.value.ChangeListener;
import javafx.stage.DirectoryChooser;

import java.io.*;
import java.nio.file.*;
import java.time.LocalDateTime;
import java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter;
import org.apache.poi.xssf.usermodel.*;
import org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.*;

import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;

public class RFCController {
 // Existing FXML fields...
 
 @FXML
 private void handleGenerateButton() {
 if (validateForm()) {
 try {
 // Ask user for output directory
 DirectoryChooser directoryChooser = new DirectoryChooser();
 directoryChooser.setTitle("Select Output Directory");
 File outputDir = directoryChooser.showDialog(titleField.getScene().getWindow());
 
 if (outputDir != null) {
 // Generate the RFC document
 File generatedFile = generateRFCDocument(outputDir);
 
 // Show success alert
 Alert alert = new Alert(Alert.AlertType.INFORMATION);
 alert.setTitle("RFC Generated");
 alert.setHeaderText("RFC Document Created Successfully");
 alert.setContentText("The RFC document has been saved to:\n" + generatedFile.getAbsolutePath());
 alert.showAndWait();
 
 // Return to home screen
 mainController.showHomeScene();
 }
 } catch (Exception e) {
 // Show error alert
 Alert alert = new Alert(Alert.AlertType.ERROR);
 alert.setTitle("Error");
 alert.setHeaderText("Failed to Generate RFC");
 alert.setContentText("An error occurred: " + e.getMessage());
 alert.showAndWait();
 e.printStackTrace();
 }
 }
 }
 
 private File generateRFCDocument(File outputDir) throws IOException {
 // Get template file
 InputStream templateStream = getClass().getResourceAsStream("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/input/RFC.xlsx");
 if (templateStream == null) {
 throw new FileNotFoundException("RFC template file not found");
 }
 
 // Create a unique filename with project code and timestamp
 String timestamp = LocalDateTime.now().format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyyMMdd_HHmmss"));
 String projectCode = projectCodeField.getText().replaceAll("[^a-zA-Z0-9]", "_");
 String outputFileName = "RFC_" + projectCode + "_" + timestamp + ".xlsx";
 File outputFile = new File(outputDir, outputFileName);
 
 // Load the Excel workbook
 XSSFWorkbook workbook = new XSSFWorkbook(templateStream);
 XSSFSheet sheet = workbook.getSheetAt(0); // Assuming data goes in first sheet
 
 // Map of field values
 Map<String, String> fieldValues = new HashMap<>();
 fieldValues.put("RFC_TYPE", rfcTypeComboBox.getValue());
 fieldValues.put("AREA", areaComboBox.getValue());
 fieldValues.put("PROJECT_CODE", projectCodeField.getText());
 fieldValues.put("CITY", cityComboBox.getValue());
 fieldValues.put("INITIATOR", initiatorField.getText());
 fieldValues.put("EMAIL", emailField.getText());
 fieldValues.put("PHONE", phoneField.getText());
 fieldValues.put("TITLE", titleField.getText());
 fieldValues.put("INITIAL_SCOPE", initialScopeArea.getText());
 fieldValues.put("BACKGROUND", backgroundArea.getText());
 fieldValues.put("PROPOSED_CHANGE", proposedChangeArea.getText());
 
 // Impact areas
 fieldValues.put("DESIGN_IMPACT", designImpactComboBox.getValue());
 if ("Yes".equals(designImpactComboBox.getValue())) {
 fieldValues.put("DESIGN_IMPACT_DETAILS", designImpactField.getText());
 }
 
 fieldValues.put("PERMIT_IMPACT", permitImpactComboBox.getValue());
 if ("Yes".equals(permitImpactComboBox.getValue())) {
 fieldValues.put("PERMIT_IMPACT_DETAILS", permitImpactField.getText());
 }
 
 fieldValues.put("ATTACHMENTS", attachmentsArea.getText());
 
 // Fill the Excel template with data
 // This is a simplified approach - you'll need to adjust cell references based on your template
 int rowIndex = 1; // Start from row 1 (after header)
 for (Map.Entry<String, String> entry : fieldValues.entrySet()) {
 Row row = sheet.getRow(rowIndex);
 if (row == null) {
 row = sheet.createRow(rowIndex);
 }
 
 // Column 0 for field name, column 1 for value
 Cell keyCell = row.createCell(0);
 keyCell.setCellValue(entry.getKey());
 
 Cell valueCell = row.createCell(1);
 valueCell.setCellValue(entry.getValue() != null ? entry.getValue() : "");
 
 rowIndex++;
 }
 
 // Write the workbook to the output file
 try (FileOutputStream fileOut = new FileOutputStream(outputFile)) {
 workbook.write(fileOut);
 }
 
 workbook.close();
 templateStream.close();
 
 return outputFile;
 }
 
 // Existing methods...
}
```

Now, let's modify the `RFIController.java`:

<augment_code_snippet path="Enset/ProjectManagement/src/main/java/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/controllers/RFIController.java" mode="EDIT">
```java
package com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers;

import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.MainController;
import javafx.collections.FXCollections;
import javafx.fxml.FXML;
import javafx.scene.control.*;
import javafx.stage.DirectoryChooser;

import java.io.*;
import java.nio.file.*;
import java.time.LocalDate;
import java.time.LocalDateTime;
import java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter;

import org.apache.poi.xwpf.usermodel.*;

import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;

public class RFIController {
 // Existing FXML fields...
 
 @FXML
 private void handleGenerateButton() {
 if (validateForm()) {
 try {
 // Ask user for output directory
 DirectoryChooser directoryChooser = new DirectoryChooser();
 directoryChooser.setTitle("Select Output Directory");
 File outputDir = directoryChooser.showDialog(projectNameField.getScene().getWindow());
 
 if (outputDir != null) {
 // Generate the RFI document
 File generatedFile = generateRFIDocument(outputDir);
 
 // Show success alert
 Alert alert = new Alert(Alert.AlertType.INFORMATION);
 alert.setTitle("RFI Generated");
 alert.setHeaderText("RFI Document Created Successfully");
 alert.setContentText("The RFI document has been saved to:\n" + generatedFile.getAbsolutePath());
 alert.showAndWait();
 
 // Return to home screen
 mainController.showHomeScene();
 }
 } catch (Exception e) {
 // Show error alert
 Alert alert = new Alert(Alert.AlertType.ERROR);
 alert.setTitle("Error");
 alert.setHeaderText("Failed to Generate RFI");
 alert.setContentText("An error occurred: " + e.getMessage());
 alert.showAndWait();
 e.printStackTrace();
 }
 }
 }
 
 private File generateRFIDocument(File outputDir) throws IOException {
 // Get template file
 InputStream templateStream = getClass().getResourceAsStream("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/input/RFI.docx");
 if (templateStream == null) {
 throw new FileNotFoundException("RFI template file not found");
 }
 
 // Create a unique filename with project name and timestamp
 String timestamp = LocalDateTime.now().format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyyMMdd_HHmmss"));
 String projectName = projectNameField.getText().replaceAll("[^a-zA-Z0-9]", "_");
 String outputFileName = "RFI_" + projectName + "_" + timestamp + ".docx";
 File outputFile = new File(outputDir, outputFileName);
 
 // Load the Word document
 XWPFDocument document = new XWPFDocument(templateStream);
 
 // Map of placeholders to values
 Map<String, String> placeholders = new HashMap<>();
 placeholders.put("${PROJECT_NAME}", projectNameField.getText());
 placeholders.put("${DEADLINE}", deadlinePicker.getValue().toString());
 placeholders.put("${OVERVIEW}", overviewArea.getText());
 placeholders.put("${COST_VARIATION}", costVariationComboBox.getValue());
 placeholders.put("${TIME_CHANGE}", timeChangeComboBox.getValue());
 placeholders.put("${REQUEST}", requestArea.getText());
 placeholders.put("${REQUESTING_PARTY}", requestingPartyField.getText());
 placeholders.put("${GENERATION_DATE}", LocalDate.now().toString());
 
 // Replace placeholders in paragraphs
 for (XWPFParagraph paragraph : document.getParagraphs()) {
 for (XWPFRun run : paragraph.getRuns()) {
 String text = run.getText(0);
 if (text != null) {
 for (Map.Entry<String, String> entry : placeholders.entrySet()) {
 if (text.contains(entry.getKey())) {
 text = text.replace(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
 }
 }
 run.setText(text, 0);
 }
 }
 }
 
 // Replace placeholders in tables
 for (XWPFTable table : document.getTables()) {
 for (XWPFTableRow row : table.getRows()) {
 for (XWPFTableCell cell : row.getTableCells()) {
 for (XWPFParagraph paragraph : cell.getParagraphs()) {
 for (XWPFRun run : paragraph.getRuns()) {
 String text = run.getText(0);
 if (text != null) {
 for (Map.Entry<String, String> entry : placeholders.entrySet()) {
 if (text.contains(entry.getKey())) {
 text = text.replace(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
 }
 }
 run.setText(text, 0);
 }
 }
 }
 }
 }
 }
 
 // Write the document to the output file
 try (FileOutputStream fileOut = new FileOutputStream(outputFile)) {
 document.write(fileOut);
 }
 
 document.close();
 templateStream.close();
 
 return outputFile;
 }
 
 // Existing methods...
}
```
</augment_code_snippet>

You'll also need to add the following dependencies to your `pom.xml` file:

<augment_code_snippet path="Enset/ProjectManagement/pom.xml" mode="EDIT">
```xml
<dependencies>
 <!-- Existing dependencies -->
 
 <!-- Apache POI for Excel files -->
 <dependency>
 <groupId>org.apache.poi</groupId>
 <artifactId>poi</artifactId>
 <version>5.2.3</version>
 </dependency>
 <dependency>
 <groupId>org.apache.poi</groupId>
 <artifactId>poi-ooxml</artifactId>
 <version>5.2.3</version>
 </dependency>
</dependencies>
```
</augment_code_snippet>

Finally, you need to create the input directory structure and add template files:

1. Create directory: `src/main/resources/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/input/`
2. Add template files:
 - `RFC.xlsx` - Excel template for RFC
 - `RFI.docx` - Word template for RFI

The implementation:
1. Asks the user to select an output directory
2. Creates a copy of the template with a unique filename based on project name/code and timestamp
3. Fills in the template with user-provided data
4. Saves the completed document to the selected output directory
5. Shows a success message with the file path

Note: The exact cell/placeholder references in the templates will need to be adjusted based on your actual template designs.

````java path=Enset/ProjectManagement/src/main/java/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/controllers/RFCController.java mode=EDIT
package com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers;

import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.MainController;
import javafx.collections.FXCollections;
import javafx.fxml.FXML;
import javafx.scene.control.*;
import javafx.beans.value.ChangeListener;
import javafx.stage.DirectoryChooser;

import java.io.*;
import java.nio.file.*;
import java.time.LocalDateTime;
import java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter;
import org.apache.poi.xssf.usermodel.*;
import org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.*;

import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;

public class RFCController {
 // Existing FXML fields...
 
 @FXML
 private void handleGenerateButton() {
 if (validateForm()) {
 try {
 // Ask user for output directory
 DirectoryChooser directoryChooser = new DirectoryChooser();
 directoryChooser.setTitle("Select Output Directory");
 File outputDir = directoryChooser.showDialog(titleField.getScene().getWindow());
 
 if (outputDir != null) {
 // Generate the RFC document
 File generatedFile = generateRFCDocument(outputDir);
 
 // Show success alert
 Alert alert = new Alert(Alert.AlertType.INFORMATION);
 alert.setTitle("RFC Generated");
 alert.setHeaderText("RFC Document Created Successfully");
 alert.setContentText("The RFC document has been saved to:\n" + generatedFile.getAbsolutePath());
 alert.showAndWait();
 
 // Return to home screen
 mainController.showHomeScene();
 }
 } catch (Exception e) {
 // Show error alert
 Alert alert = new Alert(Alert.AlertType.ERROR);
 alert.setTitle("Error");
 alert.setHeaderText("Failed to Generate RFC");
 alert.setContentText("An error occurred: " + e.getMessage());
 alert.showAndWait();
 e.printStackTrace();
 }
 }
 }
 
 private File generateRFCDocument(File outputDir) throws IOException {
 // Get template file
 InputStream templateStream = getClass().getResourceAsStream("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/input/RFC.xlsx");
 if (templateStream == null) {
 throw new FileNotFoundException("RFC template file not found");
 }
 
 // Create a unique filename with project code and timestamp
 String timestamp = LocalDateTime.now().format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyyMMdd_HHmmss"));
 String projectCode = projectCodeField.getText().replaceAll("[^a-zA-Z0-9]", "_");
 String outputFileName = "RFC_" + projectCode + "_" + timestamp + ".xlsx";
 File outputFile = new File(outputDir, outputFileName);
 
 // Load the Excel workbook
 XSSFWorkbook workbook = new XSSFWorkbook(templateStream);
 XSSFSheet sheet = workbook.getSheetAt(0); // Assuming data goes in first sheet
 
 // Map of field values
 Map<String, String> fieldValues = new HashMap<>();
 fieldValues.put("RFC_TYPE", rfcTypeComboBox.getValue());
 fieldValues.put("AREA", areaComboBox.getValue());
 fieldValues.put("PROJECT_CODE", projectCodeField.getText());
 fieldValues.put("CITY", cityComboBox.getValue());
 fieldValues.put("INITIATOR", initiatorField.getText());
 fieldValues.put("EMAIL", emailField.getText());
 fieldValues.put("PHONE", phoneField.getText());
 fieldValues.put("TITLE", titleField.getText());
 fieldValues.put("INITIAL_SCOPE", initialScopeArea.getText());
 fieldValues.put("BACKGROUND", backgroundArea.getText());
 fieldValues.put("PROPOSED_CHANGE", proposedChangeArea.getText());
 
 // Impact areas
 fieldValues.put("DESIGN_IMPACT", designImpactComboBox.getValue());
 if ("Yes".equals(designImpactComboBox.getValue())) {
 fieldValues.put("DESIGN_IMPACT_DETAILS", designImpactField.getText());
 }
 
 fieldValues.put("PERMIT_IMPACT", permitImpactComboBox.getValue());
 if ("Yes".equals(permitImpactComboBox.getValue())) {
 fieldValues.put("PERMIT_IMPACT_DETAILS", permitImpactField.getText());
 }
 
 fieldValues.put("ATTACHMENTS", attachmentsArea.getText());
 
 // Fill the Excel template with data
 // This is a simplified approach - you'll need to adjust cell references based on your template
 int rowIndex = 1; // Start from row 1 (after header)
 for (Map.Entry<String, String> entry : fieldValues.entrySet()) {
 Row row = sheet.getRow(rowIndex);
 if (row == null) {
 row = sheet.createRow(rowIndex);
 }
 
 // Column 0 for field name, column 1 for value
 Cell keyCell = row.createCell(0);
 keyCell.setCellValue(entry.getKey());
 
 Cell valueCell = row.createCell(1);
 valueCell.setCellValue(entry.getValue() != null ? entry.getValue() : "");
 
 rowIndex++;
 }
 
 // Write the workbook to the output file
 try (FileOutputStream fileOut = new FileOutputStream(outputFile)) {
 workbook.write(fileOut);
 }
 
 workbook.close();
 templateStream.close();
 
 return outputFile;
 }
 
 // Existing methods...
}
````

Now, let's modify the `RFIController.java`:

````java path=Enset/ProjectManagement/src/main/java/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/controllers/RFIController.java mode=EDIT
package com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers;

import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.MainController;
import javafx.collections.FXCollections;
import javafx.fxml.FXML;
import javafx.scene.control.*;
import javafx.stage.DirectoryChooser;

import java.io.*;
import java.nio.file.*;
import java.time.LocalDate;
import java.time.LocalDateTime;
import java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter;

import org.apache.poi.xwpf.usermodel.*;

import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;

public class RFIController {
 // Existing FXML fields...
 
 @FXML
 private void handleGenerateButton() {
 if (validateForm()) {
 try {
 // Ask user for output directory
 DirectoryChooser directoryChooser = new DirectoryChooser();
 directoryChooser.setTitle("Select Output Directory");
 File outputDir = directoryChooser.showDialog(projectNameField.getScene().getWindow());
 
 if (outputDir != null) {
 // Generate the RFI document
 File generatedFile = generateRFIDocument(outputDir);
 
 // Show success alert
 Alert alert = new Alert(Alert.AlertType.INFORMATION);
 alert.setTitle("RFI Generated");
 alert.setHeaderText("RFI Document Created Successfully");
 alert.setContentText("The RFI document has been saved to:\n" + generatedFile.getAbsolutePath());
 alert.showAndWait();
 
 // Return to home screen
 mainController.showHomeScene();
 }
 } catch (Exception e) {
 // Show error alert
 Alert alert = new Alert(Alert.AlertType.ERROR);
 alert.setTitle("Error");
 alert.setHeaderText("Failed to Generate RFI");
 alert.setContentText("An error occurred: " + e.getMessage());
 alert.showAndWait();
 e.printStackTrace();
 }
 }
 }
 
 private File generateRFIDocument(File outputDir) throws IOException {
 // Get template file
 InputStream templateStream = getClass().getResourceAsStream("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/input/RFI.docx");
 if (templateStream == null) {
 throw new FileNotFoundException("RFI template file not found");
 }
 
 // Create a unique filename with project name and timestamp
 String timestamp = LocalDateTime.now().format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyyMMdd_HHmmss"));
 String projectName = projectNameField.getText().replaceAll("[^a-zA-Z0-9]", "_");
 String outputFileName = "RFI_" + projectName + "_" + timestamp + ".docx";
 File outputFile = new File(outputDir, outputFileName);
 
 // Load the Word document
 XWPFDocument document = new XWPFDocument(templateStream);
 
 // Map of placeholders to values
 Map<String, String> placeholders = new HashMap<>();
 placeholders.put("${PROJECT_NAME}", projectNameField.getText());
 placeholders.put("${DEADLINE}", deadlinePicker.getValue().toString());
 placeholders.put("${OVERVIEW}", overviewArea.getText());
 placeholders.put("${COST_VARIATION}", costVariationComboBox.getValue());
 placeholders.put("${TIME_CHANGE}", timeChangeComboBox.getValue());
 placeholders.put("${REQUEST}", requestArea.getText());
 placeholders.put("${REQUESTING_PARTY}", requestingPartyField.getText());
 placeholders.put("${GENERATION_DATE}", LocalDate.now().toString());
 
 // Replace placeholders in paragraphs
 for (XWPFParagraph paragraph : document.getParagraphs()) {
 for (XWPFRun run : paragraph.getRuns()) {
 String text = run.getText(0);
 if (text != null) {
 for (Map.Entry<String, String> entry : placeholders.entrySet()) {
 if (text.contains(entry.getKey())) {
 text = text.replace(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
 }
 }
 run.setText(text, 0);
 }
 }
 }
 
 // Replace placeholders in tables
 for (XWPFTable table : document.getTables()) {
 for (XWPFTableRow row : table.getRows()) {
 for (XWPFTableCell cell : row.getTableCells()) {
 for (XWPFParagraph paragraph : cell.getParagraphs()) {
 for (XWPFRun run : paragraph.getRuns()) {
 String text = run.getText(0);
 if (text != null) {
 for (Map.Entry<String, String> entry : placeholders.entrySet()) {
 if (text.contains(entry.getKey())) {
 text = text.replace(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
 }
 }
 run.setText(text, 0);
 }
 }
 }
 }
 }
 }
 
 // Write the document to the output file
 try (FileOutputStream fileOut = new FileOutputStream(outputFile)) {
 document.write(fileOut);
 }
 
 document.close();
 templateStream.close();
 
 return outputFile;
 }
 
 // Existing methods...
}
````

Finally, you need to create the input directory structure and add template files:

1. Create directory: `src/main/resources/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/input/`
2. Add template files:
 - `RFC.xlsx` - Excel template for RFC
 - `RFI.docx` - Word template for RFI

The implementation:
1. Asks the user to select an output directory
2. Creates a copy of the template with a unique filename based on project name/code and timestamp
3. Fills in the template with user-provided data
4. Saves the completed document to the selected output directory
5. Shows a success message with the file path

Note: The exact cell/placeholder references in the templates will need to be adjusted based on your actual template designs.

 private File generateRFIDocument(File outputDir) throws IOException {

 InputStream templateStream = getClass().getResourceAsStream("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/input/RFI.docx");

 throw new FileNotFoundException("RFI template file not found");
 }
 
 // Create a unique filename with project name and timestamp
 String timestamp = LocalDateTime.now().format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyyMMdd_HHmmss"));

 File outputFile = new File(outputDir, outputFileName);
 
 // Load the Word document
 XWPFDocument document = new XWPFDocument(templateStream);
 
 // Map of placeholders to values
 Map<String, String> placeholders = new HashMap<>();
 placeholders.put("${PROJECT_NAME}", projectNameField.getText());
 placeholders.put("${DEADLINE}", deadlinePicker.getValue().toString());
 placeholders.put("${OVERVIEW}", overviewArea.getText());
 placeholders.put("${COST_VARIATION}", costVariationComboBox.getValue());
 placeholders.put("${TIME_CHANGE}", timeChangeComboBox.getValue());
 placeholders.put("${REQUEST}", requestArea.getText());
 placeholders.put("${REQUESTING_PARTY}", requestingPartyField.getText());
 placeholders.put("${GENERATION_DATE}", LocalDate.now().toString());
 
 // Replace placeholders in paragraphs
 for (XWPFParagraph paragraph : document.getParagraphs()) {
 for (XWPFRun run : paragraph.getRuns()) {
 String text = run.getText(0);
 if (text != null) {
 for (Map.Entry<String, String> entry : placeholders.entrySet()) {
 if (text.contains(entry.getKey())) {
 text = text.replace(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
 }
 }
 run.setText(text, 0);
 }
 }
 }
 
 // Replace placeholders in tables
 for (XWPFTable table : document.getTables()) {
 for (XWPFTableRow row : table.getRows()) {
 for (XWPFTableCell cell : row.getTableCells()) {
 for (XWPFParagraph paragraph : cell.getParagraphs()) {
 for (XWPFRun run : paragraph.getRuns()) {
 String text = run.getText(0);
 if (text != null) {
 for (Map.Entry<String, String> entry : placeholders.entrySet()) {
 if (text.contains(entry.getKey())) {
 text = text.replace(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
 }
 }
 run.setText(text, 0);
 }
 }
 }
 }
 }
 }
 
 // Write the document to the output file
 try (FileOutputStream fileOut = new FileOutputStream(outputFile)) {
 document.write(fileOut);
 }

 templateStream.close();

private File generateRFCDocument(File outputDir) throws IOException {
 // Get template file
 InputStream templateStream = getClass().getResourceAsStream("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/input/RFC.xlsx");
 if (templateStream == null) {
 throw new FileNotFoundException("RFC template file not found");
 }
 
 // Create a unique filename with project code and timestamp
 String timestamp = LocalDateTime.now().format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyyMMdd_HHmmss"));
 String projectCode = projectCodeField.getText().replaceAll("[^a-zA-Z0-9]", "_");
 String outputFileName = "RFC_" + projectCode + "_" + timestamp + ".xlsx";
 File outputFile = new File(outputDir, outputFileName);
 
 // Load the Excel workbook
 XSSFWorkbook workbook = new XSSFWorkbook(templateStream);
 XSSFSheet sheet = workbook.getSheetAt(0); // Assuming data goes in first sheet
 
 // Set RFC Type and color the appropriate cell
 String rfcType = rfcTypeComboBox.getValue();
 if (rfcType != null) {
 // Create a light green cell style
 XSSFCellStyle lightGreenStyle = workbook.createCellStyle();
 lightGreenStyle.setFillForegroundColor(IndexedColors.LIGHT_GREEN.getIndex());
 lightGreenStyle.setFillPattern(FillPatternType.SOLID_FOREGROUND);
 
 // Apply style to the appropriate cell based on RFC type
 if ("STANDARDS EXCEPTION REQUEST".equals(rfcType)) {
 Cell cell = getOrCreateCell(sheet, 2, 2); // C3
 cell.setCellStyle(lightGreenStyle);
 } else if ("PROJECT SCOPE CHANGE REQUEST".equals(rfcType)) {
 Cell cell = getOrCreateCell(sheet, 3, 2); // C4
 cell.setCellStyle(lightGreenStyle);
 } else if ("PROCEDURE / CONTRACTUAL CHANGE REQUEST".equals(rfcType)) {
 Cell cell = getOrCreateCell(sheet, 4, 2); // C5
 cell.setCellStyle(lightGreenStyle);
 }
 }
 
 // Fill in the form fields
 // Project code
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 11, 1).setCellValue(projectCodeField.getText()); // B12
 
 // Area of application
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 8, 1).setCellValue(areaComboBox.getValue()); // B9
 
 // City
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 11, 4).setCellValue(cityComboBox.getValue()); // E12
 
 // Today's date
 String today = LocalDateTime.now().format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyy-MM-dd"));
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 13, 1).setCellValue(today); // B14
 
 // Initiator
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 13, 4).setCellValue(initiatorField.getText()); // E14
 
 // Contact email
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 15, 1).setCellValue(emailField.getText()); // B16
 
 // Phone number
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 15, 4).setCellValue(phoneField.getText()); // E16
 
 // Title
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 19, 1).setCellValue(titleField.getText()); // B20
 
 // Initial scope / Situation
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 22, 1).setCellValue(initialScopeArea.getText()); // B23
 
 // Background/ justification / reason for change
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 25, 1).setCellValue(backgroundArea.getText()); // B26
 
 // Proposed change: final scope / Situation
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 28, 1).setCellValue(proposedChangeArea.getText()); // B29
 
 // Design impact
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 32, 3).setCellValue(designImpactComboBox.getValue()); // D33
 if ("Yes".equals(designImpactComboBox.getValue())) {
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 32, 4).setCellValue(designImpactField.getText()); // E33
 }
 
 // Permit / Administrative impact
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 33, 3).setCellValue(permitImpactComboBox.getValue()); // D34
 if ("Yes".equals(permitImpactComboBox.getValue())) {
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 33, 4).setCellValue(permitImpactField.getText()); // E34
 }
 
 // Attachments (up to 5)
 String[] attachments = attachmentsArea.getText().split("\n");
 for (int i = 0; i < Math.min(attachments.length, 5); i++) {
 if (!attachments[i].trim().isEmpty()) {
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 43 + i, 2).setCellValue(attachments[i].trim()); // C44 to C48
 }
 }
 
 // Write the workbook to the output file
 try (FileOutputStream fileOut = new FileOutputStream(outputFile)) {
 workbook.write(fileOut);
 }
 
 workbook.close();
 templateStream.close();
 
 return outputFile;
}

// Helper method to get or create a cell at the specified row and column
private Cell getOrCreateCell(Sheet sheet, int rowIndex, int colIndex) {
 Row row = sheet.getRow(rowIndex);
 if (row == null) {
 row = sheet.createRow(rowIndex);
 }
 
 Cell cell = row.getCell(colIndex);
 if (cell == null) {
 cell = row.createCell(colIndex);
 }
 
 return cell;
}
```
</augment_code_snippet>

This updated implementation:

1. Maps all form fields to the correct cells in the Excel template as specified
2. Adds a helper method `getOrCreateCell()` to safely get or create cells at specific positions
3. Applies a light green fill to the appropriate cell based on the RFC type
4. Formats the date as "yyyy-MM-dd"
5. Handles attachments by splitting the text by newlines and adding up to 5 entries to cells C44-C48

The code now correctly maps the form data to the specific cells in the Excel template according to your requirements.

````java path=Enset/ProjectManagement/src/main/java/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/controllers/RFCController.java mode=EDIT
private File generateRFCDocument(File outputDir) throws IOException {
 // Get template file
 InputStream templateStream = getClass().getResourceAsStream("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/input/RFC.xlsx");
 if (templateStream == null) {
 throw new FileNotFoundException("RFC template file not found");
 }
 
 // Create a unique filename with project code and timestamp
 String timestamp = LocalDateTime.now().format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyyMMdd_HHmmss"));
 String projectCode = projectCodeField.getText().replaceAll("[^a-zA-Z0-9]", "_");
 String outputFileName = "RFC_" + projectCode + "_" + timestamp + ".xlsx";
 File outputFile = new File(outputDir, outputFileName);
 
 // Load the Excel workbook
 XSSFWorkbook workbook = new XSSFWorkbook(templateStream);
 XSSFSheet sheet = workbook.getSheetAt(0); // Assuming data goes in first sheet
 
 // Set RFC Type and color the appropriate cell
 String rfcType = rfcTypeComboBox.getValue();
 if (rfcType != null) {
 // Create a light green cell style
 XSSFCellStyle lightGreenStyle = workbook.createCellStyle();
 lightGreenStyle.setFillForegroundColor(IndexedColors.LIGHT_GREEN.getIndex());
 lightGreenStyle.setFillPattern(FillPatternType.SOLID_FOREGROUND);
 
 // Apply style to the appropriate cell based on RFC type
 if ("STANDARDS EXCEPTION REQUEST".equals(rfcType)) {
 Cell cell = getOrCreateCell(sheet, 2, 2); // C3
 cell.setCellStyle(lightGreenStyle);
 } else if ("PROJECT SCOPE CHANGE REQUEST".equals(rfcType)) {
 Cell cell = getOrCreateCell(sheet, 3, 2); // C4
 cell.setCellStyle(lightGreenStyle);
 } else if ("PROCEDURE / CONTRACTUAL CHANGE REQUEST".equals(rfcType)) {
 Cell cell = getOrCreateCell(sheet, 4, 2); // C5
 cell.setCellStyle(lightGreenStyle);
 }
 }
 
 // Fill in the form fields
 // Project code
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 11, 1).setCellValue(projectCodeField.getText()); // B12
 
 // Area of application
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 8, 1).setCellValue(areaComboBox.getValue()); // B9
 
 // City
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 11, 4).setCellValue(cityComboBox.getValue()); // E12
 
 // Today's date
 String today = LocalDateTime.now().format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyy-MM-dd"));
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 13, 1).setCellValue(today); // B14
 
 // Initiator
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 13, 4).setCellValue(initiatorField.getText()); // E14
 
 // Contact email
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 15, 1).setCellValue(emailField.getText()); // B16
 
 // Phone number
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 15, 4).setCellValue(phoneField.getText()); // E16
 
 // Title
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 19, 1).setCellValue(titleField.getText()); // B20
 
 // Initial scope / Situation
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 22, 1).setCellValue(initialScopeArea.getText()); // B23
 
 // Background/ justification / reason for change
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 25, 1).setCellValue(backgroundArea.getText()); // B26
 
 // Proposed change: final scope / Situation
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 28, 1).setCellValue(proposedChangeArea.getText()); // B29
 
 // Design impact
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 32, 3).setCellValue(designImpactComboBox.getValue()); // D33
 if ("Yes".equals(designImpactComboBox.getValue())) {
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 32, 4).setCellValue(designImpactField.getText()); // E33
 }
 
 // Permit / Administrative impact
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 33, 3).setCellValue(permitImpactComboBox.getValue()); // D34
 if ("Yes".equals(permitImpactComboBox.getValue())) {
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 33, 4).setCellValue(permitImpactField.getText()); // E34
 }
 
 // Attachments (up to 5)
 String[] attachments = attachmentsArea.getText().split("\n");
 for (int i = 0; i < Math.min(attachments.length, 5); i++) {
 if (!attachments[i].trim().isEmpty()) {
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 43 + i, 2).setCellValue(attachments[i].trim()); // C44 to C48
 }
 }
 
 // Write the workbook to the output file
 try (FileOutputStream fileOut = new FileOutputStream(outputFile)) {
 workbook.write(fileOut);
 }
 
 workbook.close();
 templateStream.close();
 
 return outputFile;
}

// Helper method to get or create a cell at the specified row and column
private Cell getOrCreateCell(Sheet sheet, int rowIndex, int colIndex) {
 Row row = sheet.getRow(rowIndex);
 if (row == null) {
 row = sheet.createRow(rowIndex);
 }
 
 Cell cell = row.getCell(colIndex);
 if (cell == null) {
 cell = row.createCell(colIndex);
 }
 
 return cell;
}
````

This updated implementation:

1. Maps all form fields to the correct cells in the Excel template as specified
2. Adds a helper method `getOrCreateCell()` to safely get or create cells at specific positions
3. Applies a light green fill to the appropriate cell based on the RFC type
4. Formats the date as "yyyy-MM-dd"
5. Handles attachments by splitting the text by newlines and adding up to 5 entries to cells C44-C48

The code now correctly maps the form data to the specific cells in the Excel template according to your requirements.

package com.zakaria.projectmanagement.controllers;

import com.zakaria.projectmanagement.MainController;
import javafx.collections.FXCollections;
import javafx.fxml.FXML;
import javafx.scene.control.*;
import javafx.stage.DirectoryChooser;

import java.io.*;
import java.nio.file.*;
import java.time.LocalDate;
import java.time.LocalDateTime;
import java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter;

import org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.*;
import org.apache.poi.xssf.usermodel.*;

public class RFIController {
 @FXML private TextField projectNameField;
 @FXML private DatePicker deadlinePicker;
 @FXML private TextArea overviewArea;
 @FXML private ComboBox<String> costVariationComboBox;
 @FXML private ComboBox<String> timeChangeComboBox;
 @FXML private TextArea requestArea;
 @FXML private TextField requestingPartyField;

 private MainController mainController;

 @FXML
 public void initialize() {
 // Initialize dropdown values
 costVariationComboBox.setItems(FXCollections.observableArrayList(
 "No change", "Cost Increase", "Cost Decrease"
 ));

 timeChangeComboBox.setItems(FXCollections.observableArrayList(
 "No change", "Increase in time", "Decrease in time"
 ));

 // Set default date to today
 deadlinePicker.setValue(LocalDate.now());
 }

 public void setMainController(MainController mainController) {
 this.mainController = mainController;
 }

 @FXML
 private void handleBackButton() {
 mainController.showHomeScene();
 }

 @FXML
 private void handleGenerateButton() {
 if (validateForm()) {
 try {
 // Ask user for output directory
 DirectoryChooser directoryChooser = new DirectoryChooser();
 directoryChooser.setTitle("Select Output Directory");
 File outputDir = directoryChooser.showDialog(projectNameField.getScene().getWindow());
 
 if (outputDir != null) {
 // Generate the RFI document
 File generatedFile = generateRFIDocument(outputDir);
 
 // Show success alert
 Alert alert = new Alert(Alert.AlertType.INFORMATION);
 alert.setTitle("RFI Generated");
 alert.setHeaderText("RFI Document Created Successfully");
 alert.setContentText("The RFI document has been saved to:\n" + generatedFile.getAbsolutePath());
 alert.showAndWait();
 
 // Return to home screen
 mainController.showHomeScene();
 }
 } catch (Exception e) {
 // Show error alert
 Alert alert = new Alert(Alert.AlertType.ERROR);
 alert.setTitle("Error");
 alert.setHeaderText("Failed to Generate RFI");
 alert.setContentText("An error occurred: " + e.getMessage());
 alert.showAndWait();
 e.printStackTrace();
 }
 }
 }
 
 private File generateRFIDocument(File outputDir) throws IOException {
 // Get template file
 InputStream templateStream = getClass().getResourceAsStream("/com/zakaria/projectmanagement/input/RFI.xlsx");
 if (templateStream == null) {
 throw new FileNotFoundException("RFI template file not found");
 }
 
 // Create a unique filename with project name and timestamp
 String timestamp = LocalDateTime.now().format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyyMMdd_HHmmss"));
 String projectName = projectNameField.getText().replaceAll("[^a-zA-Z0-9]", "_");
 String outputFileName = "RFI_" + projectName + "_" + timestamp + ".xlsx";
 File outputFile = new File(outputDir, outputFileName);
 
 // Load the Excel workbook
 XSSFWorkbook workbook = new XSSFWorkbook(templateStream);
 XSSFSheet sheet = workbook.getSheetAt(0); // Assuming data goes in first sheet
 
 // Fill in the form fields
 // Project Name -> A4
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 3, 0).setCellValue(projectNameField.getText());
 
 // Response Deadline -> H4
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 3, 7).setCellValue(deadlinePicker.getValue().toString());
 
 // Overview -> A6
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 5, 0).setCellValue(overviewArea.getText());
 
 // Cost Variation checkboxes
 String costVariation = costVariationComboBox.getValue();
 // Create a checkmark style
 XSSFCellStyle checkmarkStyle = workbook.createCellStyle();
 XSSFFont font = workbook.createFont();
 font.setFontName("Wingdings 2");
 font.setCharSet(XSSFFont.DEFAULT_CHARSET);
 checkmarkStyle.setFont(font);
 
 // Set the appropriate checkbox based on selection
 if ("No change".equals(costVariation)) {
 Cell cell = getOrCreateCell(sheet, 7, 0); // A8
 cell.setCellValue("R"); // Wingdings 2 checkmark
 cell.setCellStyle(checkmarkStyle);
 } else if ("Cost Increase".equals(costVariation)) {
 Cell cell = getOrCreateCell(sheet, 8, 0); // A9
 cell.setCellValue("R"); // Wingdings 2 checkmark
 cell.setCellStyle(checkmarkStyle);
 } else if ("Cost Decrease".equals(costVariation)) {
 Cell cell = getOrCreateCell(sheet, 9, 0); // A10
 cell.setCellValue("R"); // Wingdings 2 checkmark
 cell.setCellStyle(checkmarkStyle);
 }
 
 // Time Change checkboxes
 String timeChange = timeChangeComboBox.getValue();
 if ("No change".equals(timeChange)) {
 Cell cell = getOrCreateCell(sheet, 7, 4); // E8
 cell.setCellValue("R"); // Wingdings 2 checkmark
 cell.setCellStyle(checkmarkStyle);
 } else if ("Increase in time".equals(timeChange)) {
 Cell cell = getOrCreateCell(sheet, 8, 4); // E9
 cell.setCellValue("R"); // Wingdings 2 checkmark
 cell.setCellStyle(checkmarkStyle);
 } else if ("Decrease in time".equals(timeChange)) {
 Cell cell = getOrCreateCell(sheet, 9, 4); // E10
 cell.setCellValue("R"); // Wingdings 2 checkmark
 cell.setCellStyle(checkmarkStyle);
 }
 
 // Request/Clarification Required -> A13
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 12, 0).setCellValue(requestArea.getText());
 
 // Requesting Party -> A20
 getOrCreateCell(sheet, 19, 0).setCellValue(requestingPartyField.getText());
 
 // Write the workbook to the output file
 try (FileOutputStream fileOut = new FileOutputStream(outputFile)) {
 workbook.write(fileOut);
 }
 
 workbook.close();
 templateStream.close();
 
 return outputFile;
 }
 
 // Helper method to get or create a cell at the specified row and column
 private Cell getOrCreateCell(Sheet sheet, int rowIndex, int colIndex) {
 Row row = sheet.getRow(rowIndex);
 if (row == null) {
 row = sheet.createRow(rowIndex);
 }
 
 Cell cell = row.getCell(colIndex);
 if (cell == null) {
 cell = row.createCell(colIndex);
 }
 
 return cell;
 }

 private boolean validateForm() {
 StringBuilder errorMessage = new StringBuilder();

 // Check required fields
 if (isNullOrEmpty(projectNameField.getText())) {
 errorMessage.append("Please enter a Project Name.\n");
 }

 if (deadlinePicker.getValue() == null) {
 errorMessage.append("Please select a Deadline for Response.\n");
 }

 if (isNullOrEmpty(overviewArea.getText())) {
 errorMessage.append("Please provide a Short Overview of the RFI.\n");
 }

 if (costVariationComboBox.getValue() == null) {
 errorMessage.append("Please select a Cost Variation option.\n");
 }

 if (timeChangeComboBox.getValue() == null) {
 errorMessage.append("Please select a Change in Time option.\n");
 }

 if (isNullOrEmpty(requestArea.getText())) {
 errorMessage.append("Please describe the Request/Clarification Required.\n");
 }

 if (isNullOrEmpty(requestingPartyField.getText())) {
 errorMessage.append("Please enter the Requesting Party.\n");
 }

 // If there are validation errors, show them
 if (errorMessage.length() > 0) {
 Alert alert = new Alert(Alert.AlertType.ERROR);
 alert.setTitle("Form Validation Error");
 alert.setHeaderText("Please correct the following errors:");
 alert.setContentText(errorMessage.toString());
 alert.showAndWait();
 return false;
 }

 return true;
 }

 private boolean isNullOrEmpty(String text) {
 return text == null || text.trim().isEmpty() || text.trim().matches("^(hahaha|ssss)$");
 }
}
```
</augment_code_snippet>

Key changes:

1. Changed the template path from `RFI.docx` to `RFI.xlsx`
2. Updated the code to use Apache POI's Excel API instead of Word API
3. Mapped the form data to the correct cells in the Excel template:
 - Project Name -> A4
 - Response Deadline -> H4
 - Overview -> A6
 - Cost Variation checkboxes (A8, A9, A10)
 - Time Change checkboxes (E8, E9, E10)
 - Request/Clarification -> A13
 - Requesting Party -> A20

4. Added a special handling for checkboxes using Wingdings 2 font with the "R" character, which appears as a checkmark

5. Reused the `getOrCreateCell()` helper method to safely get or create cells at specific positions

This implementation will generate an Excel file with the RFI data properly mapped to the specified cells in the template.
